definition: to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character

sentences.english: He is all flourishes, rococo gestures, and exquisite manners.
sentences.chinese: 他手舞足蹈，优雅地比划着繁杂的手势。

sentences.english: I said with hands moving de script ion.
sentences.chinese: 我边说边用手指着比划。

sentences.english: I don't know if I can do all of those moves.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道我能不能把那些招式都比划出来。

sentences.english: Horse eight pigeon's sound several degrees sob, gesticulated with the hand is saying.
sentences.chinese: 马八鸽的声音几度哽咽，用手比划着说完。

sentences.english: He is new in London. He says noting and points to the poli…
sentences.chinese: 他现在在伦敦，什么也不说，而是用手比划问警察。

sentences.english: I look at them strangely, as I cannot understand their gesticulations .
sentences.chinese: 我看着他奇怪的是，因为我看不理解他的比划。

sentences.english: The contrast refers to the thickness difference between vertical and horizontal strokes.
sentences.chinese: 对比是指垂直比划和水平比划间的宽度差别。

sentences.english: The contrast refers to the thickness difference between vertical and horizontal strokes.
sentences.chinese: 对比是指垂直比划和水平比划间的宽度差别。

sentences.english: To learn how to rotate an object mentally, firsttry a pantomime.
sentences.chinese: 想在心里旋转一个物体，要首先试着比划。

sentences.english: Foreign reporter said that while uses the hand to gesticulate watch tower structure thickness.
sentences.chinese: 外国记者边说边用手比划着岗台的厚度。

sentences.english: My pencil followed the writing sequence of the charater on the book but didn't touch the paper.
sentences.chinese: 我拿着铅笔顺着书上比划，可没碰着纸。

sentences.english: Some of Hu's students demonstrated kung fu routines.
sentences.chinese: 胡政生的几个学员在相互比划着功夫拳脚。

definition: variant of 比劃|比划[bi3 hua5]
to make eyes/to wink
to sweep/to brush away
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
fingertip/finger
gesture/sign/signal
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
twice/for a little while
to mumble/to mutter to oneself
variant of 念念有詞|念念有词[nian4 nian4 you3 ci2]
finger/toe/CL:個|个[ge4]
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to mumble to oneself
see 嘰哩咕嚕|叽哩咕噜[ji1 li5 gu1 lu1]
